analyzed: gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / mar me dang / lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa gzhan gang yang rung ba dag gis rim gro bgyid cing; de la de dag rgyun mi chad par yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du sku gdung dang /
translated: And they will continue to do so until they have attained ultimate nirvāṇa, and even after that, until their relics are still being worshipped.

original: nyan thos dag la rnam par smin par gyur kyang bas par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: nyan thos dag la rnam par smin par gyur kyang bas par mi 'gyur na /
translated: Even if they were to be exhausted by the ripening of their results for the hearers,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi dbyings rnam par dkrug par bgyid par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi dbyings rnam par dkrug par bgyid par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: For that reason, will the Bodhisattva, the great being, not be one who disturbs the dharma-element?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord:

original: rab 'byor / gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Subhuti, it is precisely because one does not apprehend anything that

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi dbyings rnam par 'khrug par mi byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi dbyings rnam par 'khrug par mi byed de /
translated: the Bodhisattva, the great being, does not disturb the dharma-element.

original: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa dang po'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa dang po'o //
translated: And it is precisely for that reason that the Bodhisattva, the great being, has the first stage.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sa gnyis pa dang / sa gsum pa dang / sa bcu pa nyid kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sa gnyis pa dang / sa gsum pa dang / sa bcu pa nyid kyi bar du'o //
translated: And it is precisely for that reason that he has the second stage, the third stage, up to the tenth stage.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'o //
translated: And it is precisely for that reason that he has the acceptance that dharmas are not produced.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: And it is precisely for that reason that he has the superknowledges which are born of karma maturation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab bo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab bo //
translated: Therefore, it is the generosity, morality, patience, effort, meditation, and wisdom that arise from the evolution of past actions.

original: de nyid kyi @269b phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi @269b phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
translated: Therefore, it is the thirty-seven aids to awakening that arise from the evolution of past actions.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams te /
translated: Therefore, it is the roots of virtue that arise from the evolution of past actions.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: With those roots of virtue, the bodhisattva, the great being, brings beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed de /
translated: He purifies the buddhafield.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la'ang zhal zas dang / btung ba dang / na bza' dang / gzims cha dang / pho brang dang / yo byad dang / me tog dang / bdug spos dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la'ang zhal zas dang / btung ba dang / na bza' dang / gzims cha dang / pho brang dang / yo byad dang / me tog dang / bdug spos dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang /
translated: He also offers food and drink, clothing and bedding, houses and possessions, flowers, incense, perfumes,

original: phye ma dang / chos gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / mar me dang / lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa gzhan gang yang rung bdag gis rim gro byed cing /🔽de la de dag rgyun mi chad par yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du sku gdung dang / nyan thos dag la rnam par smin par gyur kyang /
analyzed: phye ma dang / chos gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / mar me dang / lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa gzhan gang yang rung bdag gis rim gro byed cing / de la de dag rgyun mi chad par yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du sku gdung dang / nyan thos dag la rnam par smin par gyur kyang /
translated: and with the finest incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, flags, lamps, and all the finest things of gods and humans.

original: zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if they were to make offerings to them continuously until they had passed into parinirvāṇa, and even if they were to make offerings to their śrāvakas, those offerings would not be exhausted.🔽”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das mi dmigs pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la bye brag ni ci zhig mchis /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das mi dmigs pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la bye brag ni ci zhig mchis /
translated: The bodhisattva Sarva­nīvaraṇa­viṣkam­bhin asked the Blessed One, “Blessed One, what is the difference between nonapprehending and generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, insight, and the superknowledges?

original: tha dad du bgyi ba ni ci zhig mchis /
analyzed: tha dad du bgyi ba ni ci zhig mchis /
translated: What is the distinction between them?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,🔽“Noble son, there is no difference between nonapprehending and generosity, discipline, patience, diligence, concentration, insight, and the superknowledges.

original: rab 'byor / mi dmigs pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la tha dad @270a *//🔽du bya ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / mi dmigs pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la tha dad @270a *// du bya ba gang yang med do //
translated: Subhūti, there is no difference to be found in generosity, morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom, and in the superknowledges.

original: rab 'byor / gos pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / gos pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa dag la ni tha dad du bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gos pa med pa'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / gos pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa dag la ni tha dad du bya bar bstan to //
translated: Subhūti, there is no difference to be found in unattached generosity, morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom, and in the unattached superknowledges.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gos pa ma mchis pa'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / mngon par shes pa rnams ji ltar tha dad du bgyi bar bstan /
analyzed: gos pa ma mchis pa'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / mngon par shes pa rnams ji ltar tha dad du bgyi bar bstan /
translated: “Subhūti, how is it that there is no difference to be found in unattached generosity, morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom, and in the superknowledges?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Subhuti : Here a Bodhisattva, a great being who courses in perfect wisdom, does not review form, etc.🔽

original: sbyin pa mi dmigs /🔽btang ba mi dmigs /🔽gtong ba po mi dmigs /🔽len pa po mi dmigs par sbyin pa gtong po //
analyzed: sbyin pa mi dmigs / btang ba mi dmigs / gtong ba po mi dmigs / len pa po mi dmigs par sbyin pa gtong po //
translated: Subhuti: Here a Bodhisattva, who courses in perfect wisdom, gives gifts without apprehending a gift, a giver, or a receiver.

original: tshul khrims mi dmigs par tshul khrims srung ngo //
analyzed: tshul khrims mi dmigs par tshul khrims srung ngo //
translated: He guards morality without apprehending morality, or one who guards morality.

original: bzod pa mi dmigs par bzod pa sgrub bo //
analyzed: bzod pa mi dmigs par bzod pa sgrub bo //
translated: He perfects patience without apprehending a patient, or patience.

original: brtson 'grus mi dmigs par brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: brtson 'grus mi dmigs par brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: He exerts vigour without apprehending a self, or vigour.

original: ting nge 'dzin mi dmigs par snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mi dmigs par snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: He becomes absorbed in the trances without apprehending the trances.

original: shes rab mi dmigs par shes rab sgom mo //
analyzed: shes rab mi dmigs par shes rab sgom mo //
translated: He develops wisdom without apprehending wisdom.

original: mngon par shes pa mi dmigs par mngon par shes pa rnams la spyod do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa mi dmigs par mngon par shes pa rnams la spyod do //
translated: He develops the superknowledges without apprehending the superknowledges.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams mi dmigs par dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la spyod do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams mi dmigs par dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la spyod do //
translated: He develops the applications of mindfulness without apprehending the applications of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / @270b byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam mi dmigs par lam la spyod do //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / @270b byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam mi dmigs par lam la spyod do //
translated: He practices the path without apprehending the right efforts, the legs of manifest ability, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, or the path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi dmigs par gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi dmigs par gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod do //
translated: He practices the formless absorptions without apprehending the noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, or the formless absorptions.

original: rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams mi dmigs par mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams mi dmigs par mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la spyod do //
translated: He practices the formless absorptions without apprehending the liberations, the perfect concentrations, or the formless absorptions.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa mi dmigs par smon pa med pa la spyod do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa mi dmigs par smon pa med pa la spyod do //
translated: He practices the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness without apprehending emptiness, signlessness, or aspirationlessness.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams mi dmigs par so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la spyod do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams mi dmigs par so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la spyod do //
translated: He practices the superknowledges, the concentrations, the dhāraṇī gateways, the powers of the tathāgatas, the fearlessnesses, and the detailed and thorough knowledges without apprehending the detailed and thorough knowledges.

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams mi dmigs par sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la spyod do //
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams mi dmigs par sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la spyod do //
translated: He practices the great love and the great compassion and the distinct attributes of the buddhas without apprehending the distinct attributes of the buddhas.

original: sems can rnams mi dmigs par sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams mi dmigs par sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: He brings beings to maturity without apprehending beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mi dmigs par sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing mi dmigs par sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: He purifies a buddhafield without apprehending a buddhafield.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mi dmigs par byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mi dmigs par byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: He fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening without apprehending the buddhadharmas.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /🔽shes @271a *// rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis / shes @271a *// rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that do not apprehend anything.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na /🔽de la bdud sdig to can rnams sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod na / de la bdud sdig to can rnams sam /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that🔽are hard for the evil Māras,

original: bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis tshugs par dka' ba yin no //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis tshugs par dka' ba yin no // de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: or the gods in the Māra class, to get at.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: ji ltar sems bskyed pa gcig gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar sems bskyed pa gcig gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: how do they take up the six perfections with a single thought?

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang /
translated: the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties,

original: stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path?

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa lnga yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa lnga yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: the three gateways to liberation, the four noble truths, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, and the five kinds of supernormal knowledge?

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: inner emptiness, outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature?

original: ting nge @271b 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /
analyzed: ting nge @271b 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /
translated: the meditative stabilities, the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great loving kindness, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas,

original: mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su 'dzin pa lags /
translated: and the thirty-two major marks and the eighty minor marks of a great person.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; rab 'byor /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Su­bhūti,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa gang gtong ba de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa las gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbyin pa gang gtong ba de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa las gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: this is how great bodhisattva beings, when they practice this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom, do not apprehend the emptiness of internal phenomena as the emptiness of internal phenomena, and they do not apprehend the other aspects of emptiness, up to and including the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, as the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: tshul khrims gang srung ba dang / bzod pa gang sgom pa dang / brtson 'grus gang rtsom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gang la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab gang sgom pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa las gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims gang srung ba dang / bzod pa gang sgom pa dang / brtson 'grus gang rtsom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gang la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab gang sgom pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa las gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: Whatever morality is guarded, whatever patience is cultivated, whatever effort is begun, whatever meditative stabilization is entered, and whatever wisdom is cultivated, that is embraced by the perfection of wisdom, not otherwise.

translated: “Subhūti, here when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gnod pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa ni /

translated: He perfects the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽He abides in those noble dharmas that are without outflows,

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /

analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la /

analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin no //

analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /

original: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa dang / byed pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa la mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis /

translated: He will perfect the five superknowledges that arise from ripening.

analyzed: tshul khrims kyis phan 'dogs so //

translated: He benefits those who should be benefited by the vision of the wisdom of liberation with the vision of the wisdom of liberation.

analyzed: gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya ba de dag kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu dgod do //

translated: and those who are established in the result of once-returners, the result of non-returners, the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, or unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they too are established in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

translated: “With many kinds of miraculous transformations they go to as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River.

original: de 'dod na 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po de dag rin po che gang las 'dod pa'i rin po che de dag las grub par mngon par bsgrubs te /

original: de sems can rnams kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
analyzed: de sems can rnams kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
translated: They fulfill the wishes of beings.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro ste /
translated: They go from world system to world system.

analyzed: des 'jig rten gyi khams de dag mthong nas ci 'dod par sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: Having seen those world systems, he takes possession of a buddha-field as he wishes.

original: 'di ltar / dper na /🔽gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i ris kyi longs spyod dang / skyid pa de lta bu dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan btsal ba dang / @293a *//
analyzed: 'di ltar / dper na / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i ris kyi longs spyod dang / skyid pa de lta bu dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan btsal ba dang / @293a *//
translated: It is like this:🔽Whatever enjoyments and pleasures there are in the god realm of the Paranirmitavasavartins, and whatever enjoyments and pleasures there are in other buddha-fields,

analyzed: bral ba dang / longs spyod dang skyid pa gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag der 'byung ste /

original: de rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /

translated: They practice the perfection of wisdom, the superknowledges that arise from evolution, and the path to enlightenment that arises from evolution,

original: chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa thob nas; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su 'thob ste /

analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su sdud do /

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgom mo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgom mo //

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas shing /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas shing /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ma gtogs par nyan thos dang thun mong pa'am /

analyzed: nye bar bsgrubs te gnas kyang /

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de dag dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu'i ro'ang myong bar mi byed do //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems @302b dpa' chen po des ting nge 'dzin de dag gi /🔽mtshan nyid med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes pas na /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems @302b dpa' chen po des ting nge 'dzin de dag gi / mtshan nyid med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du shes pas na /

analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos / mtshan nyid med pa'i chos kyis ro myong bar byed par yang ga la 'gyur /
translated: as having the defining characteristic of signlessness and the defining characteristic of the absence of an intrinsic nature.🔽How could a phenomenon without a defining characteristic

original: dngos po med pa'i chos kyang /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i chos kyang /
translated: experience the taste of a phenomenon without a defining characteristic?🔽How could a phenomenon without an intrinsic nature

original: dngos po med pa'i chos kyis ro myong bar byed par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i chos kyis ro myong bar byed par ga la 'gyur te /

analyzed: de ro myong bar byed pa med pas / ting nge 'dzin gang gis dbang gis kyang gzugs kyi khams sam /

analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: he does not take rebirth in the form realm or the formless realm through the power of any meditative absorption.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar des khams de gnyis kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: 'di ltar des khams de gnyis kyang mi dmigs /

analyzed: gang snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gang gis snyoms par 'jug par yang mi dmigs so //

analyzed: de mi dmigs pas mtshan nyid med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: By means of the meditative absorption that is without defining characteristics, he perfects the perfection of meditative absorption.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa des /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa des /
translated: And by means of that perfection of meditative absorption,

analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las yongs su 'da'o //
translated: he transcends the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / ji ltar na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyis shing /
translated: and then, on the basis of that perfection of meditative absorption,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las yongs su 'da' bar lags /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las yongs su 'da' bar lags /
translated: and transcend the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos nang stong pa nyid la shin tu bslabs pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la shin tu bslabs @303a *//🔽pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: stong pa nyid 'di dag la ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /

analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /

analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dam /
translated: and no attributes of a śrāvaka,🔽and no attributes of a pratyekabuddha,🔽and no attributes of a buddha,
